starting_post.message:
would've not use 01:58:640 (1,2,3,4,5,6,7) - since it's ruining aesthetics as well as I would've suggest to not to use 01:59:325 (1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9) - 02:00:697 (1,2,3,4,5,6,7) - type of aesthetics esp. kiai since is ruining intensivity. I want to beat the shit out of these circles. 

Maybe make them bigger spaced so it gets intensive?
Aesthetics that I would suggest is:
![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/510791426280259595/1167114515381506179/image.png?ex=654cf318&is=653a7e18&hm=850c2f669b6639676805b7b6600bc26d0999e3e4a7b301fc3a69126754ba2dd8&)
* Do not be worry, this is just the pattern I got while experimementing. Let's look at it with some details.

beatmapset.artist_unicode: 西島尊大 feat. 初音ミク
beatmapset.creator: VP757

starting_post.message:
I enjoyed the part with the vocal doubles idea until here 01:47:818 where you go really insane with the spacing which don't really match the intensity of the vocal which them becomes quite over the top at 01:53:293 (1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2) - 

01:47:818 (1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,3,1) - 01:50:008 (1,2,1,2,1,2) - these sound about all the same intensity when referring to the vocal pitch, having similar spacing for every double feels better representative of the music here, you could still change spacing and direction between the doubles to emphasize their slight changes but currently the spacing changes here don't really highlight anything important and feel unnecessary.

01:53:074 (2,3,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2) - the intensity of this sections seems to drop off from 01:47:818 whilst being mapped more intensely than this section, I understand the emphasis on the pitch change but this sudden spike in difficulty feels too out of place for the intensity of the music and it does not line up with the surrounding section.

I feel similarly about sections later such as 03:13:237, some of these spacings being so large for such soft sounds takes away from alot of the enjoyment of the map in gameplay compared to just using smaller spacing and different spacings between the double patterns to emphasize their slight differences.

beatmapset.creator: Ryu Sei

beatmapset.title: Heracles

starting_post.message:
00:20:644 -> 00:25:307

I can't truthfully say I understand your patterning and density choices here.

You represent this section with constant 1/2 despite being pretty calm (you could say you're mapping the mandarin beneath) but you stop mapping the mandarin and move to a less dense layer at 00:25:618

I also don't understand your patterning here.  The kats seem to be randomly placed and making their own pattern.  The kats in the section starting at 00:25:618 make sense since they're on the snares.

I think you should: 
1) Nerf the first section by mapping the horn that occurs every beat or so
2) Come up with patterns that represent the song better, and don't just create a new layer with no obvious logic behind it

02:47:050 (4,5,6) - 02:48:108 (8,9,10) - these are the first time you introduce overlapped 1/2s and its around 90% of the song so it's highly possible to misread them, please split them apart or just stack them (would prefer to see the former btw)

02:13:874 (5,1) - stack them or give them higher ds, they look way too like 1/2 rhythm especially putting in the context of 02:13:874 (5,1,2,3,4) - 
same for 02:19:697 (4,1) - 02:13:168 (2,3) - (the latter one is slightly less serious but still)
02:08:932 (8,9,1) - overlaps there are kinda sus so maybe just avoid them to avoid reading incidents

beatmapset.artist_unicode: 西島尊大 feat. 初音ミク
beatmapset.creator: VP757

starting_post.message:
Few reading things that were very hard to react to in playtest

01:43:512 (2,1,2) - this whole part reads as a 1/6 pattern however the gap in rhythm isn't shown via a spacing change as the spacing is suddenly very small which is very unexpected with the new rhythms used.

01:49:132 (3,1) - nc pattern changing + small spacing suddenly being used again causes 01:48:913 (1,2,3,1) - to read as a 1/6 as well with no gaps. 01:52:928 (1,2,3) - same here.

01:50:665 (1,2,3,4,5) - understand you are doing this for the vocal idea but changing up the idea of every 5 note burst being in a consistent pattern that has been built over the map really messes up the players reading due to the expectation of the pattern being broken here and the vocal really doesn't need to break this here. 03:12:124 (1,2,3,4,5) -  same here.

02:10:447 (7) - I don't see what warrants a pattern change from 02:08:694 (5) - especially since the rhythm has changed to 1/8, this could cause 02:10:392 (6,7) - to be read as 02:10:008 (1,2) - gap as the spacing is similar.

02:22:435 (1,1) - nc spam indicated a quick 1/8 and then 02:24:607 (1,1) - nc spammed again but now a 1/6 is emphasized which is very confusing, there is no discernable way to tell these rhythms have changed, the player would expect both to be 1/8 in this situation.
02:07:168 (2,3) - weird to see its ds being larger than that on 02:06:462 (2,1) - when the vocal pitch of the latter is definitely higher, so id suggest nerfing 02:07:168 (2,3) -
